definition: intimidate at the first glance (idiom); awe-inspiring/terrifying/overwhelming
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to fear

sentences.english: Perhaps it was this peculiarity that invested him with a species of ghastliness and awe.
sentences.chinese: 也许正是这个特点才使他令人望而生畏。

sentences.english: That is a daunting enough statistic.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个让人望而生畏的数据。

sentences.english: The house looked dark and forbidding .
sentences.chinese: 房子黑森森的，令人望而生畏。

sentences.english: Reportedly, the two door god affixed to the door, and all Jiaomoguiguai will be daunting.
sentences.chinese: 据说，大门上贴上两位门神，一切魔怪都会望而生畏。

sentences.english: This looks intimidating, but it's really not bad at all.
sentences.chinese: 这看起来有点令人望而生畏，但确实一点都不难。

definition: to feel intimidated
to shrink back/to flinch
to step back
to turn pale at the mention of a tiger (idiom)/to be scared at the mere mention of
hear the wind and lose gall (idiom); terror-stricken at the news
to fear/to be terrified
shiver all over though not cold/tremble with fear/shudder
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
too high to reach (idiom); eminent and unapproachable
to feel terrified/to grow apprehensive
panic-stricken
lit. to retreat three day's march (idiom); fig. to give way in the face of superior strength/a strategic withdrawal
variant of 發怵|发怵[fa1 chu4]
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
to tremble with fear
